Dear Ms. Edmon:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited
to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 placed his elbow on Youth A's neck during a restraint that
occurred on 04/30/2025.
Investigation The complainant was contacted on 05/07/2025 and had no
additional information to share.
Youth A was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1 on
05/02/2025. Youth A recalled being upset while inside the cottage
because he felt like staff were taking his stuff for no reason. He
remembered being restrained by multiple staff, including Staff 1.
He felt like he was pinned to the ground. Youth A stated that his
wrists hurt as Staff 1 was grabbing them during the restraint.
While Youth A was on the ground Staff 1 elbowed him in the
throat twice. Youth A recalled Staff 1 hitting and choking Youth A
during the restraint. He could not provide any more details on
how this occurred.
Staff 1 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 during an
announced, face-to-face visit to the facility on 05/13/2025. He
recalled his involvement in the incident beginning when he
responded to a radio call to the cottage from Staff 2. Staff 1
encountered Youth A inside the cottage and Youth A was in an
escalated state. Staff 1 believed Youth A had some sort of a
sharp object, possibly a butter knife. Staff 1 recalled Youth A
kicking items, yelling obscenities and threatening anyone near
them. Youth A grabbed an empty milk crate and swung it at Staff
1’s head. Staff 1 recalled blocking this and then attempting a
standing restraint of Youth A. He believed Youth A dropped his
2

weight immediately, and Staff 1 fell to the floor with Youth A. Staff
1 stated Youth A was on the ground laying on his back and was
continuing to try to hit and kick Staff 1. Staff 1 believed his weight
was off of Youth A. Staff 1 recalled reaching across Youth A’s
torso to attempt to grab both of Youth A’s arms and gain control.
Staff 1 denied ever having any of his body or weight on Youth A’s
neck. Staff 1 could not recall exactly who was in the room with
him at this point. He recalled asking for Staff 3 to come and assist
him in restraining Youth A. Youth A was continuously shouting
expletives and threatening Staff 1. Staff 1 recalled attempting to
communicate back to Youth A calmly, asking him to calm down so
the restraint could be ended. Staff 1 was not sure when Staff 3
arrived to assist, but he believed Staff 3 was able to get the object
out of Youth A’s hands. Staff 1 noted Staff 2 did not help in the
restraint at all. Staff 1 recalled Youth A slowly calming down and
stopping the attempts to hit Staff 1, so he was able to end the
restraint. He believed there were other staff in the cottage at that
time that began to interact with Youth A but no other youth were in
the cottage when this occurred.
Therapist 1 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 during an
announced, face-to-face visit to the facility on 05/13/2025. She
recalled walking up to the cottage and heard yelling as it was
occurring. Therapist 1 recalled Youth A being alone in the cottage
with Staff 2. Youth A was yelling, kicking items and threatening
anyone near him. Therapist 1 recalled Staff 2 stating he had
already called Staff 1 for assistance. Therapist 1 attempted to talk
with Youth A to try to de-escalate him, but she did not have any
success. After Staff 1 came to the cottage, Therapist 1 recalled
Youth A picking up a milk crate and attempting to hit Staff 1.
Therapist 1 saw Staff 1 block this with his hand. Therapist 1
recalled turning away from the situation to get more assistance
outside, and she did not see the initiation of the restraint. She
quickly came back inside and witnessed Youth A on the floor on
his back with Staff 1 attempting to restrain him. She recalled
seeing Staff 1 on the floor with Youth A, balancing himself on one
knee and having his other leg over the top of Youth A’s waist.
Staff 1 was attempting to hold Youth A’s arms as Youth A
attempted to hit Staff 1. Staff 3 joined the situation and tried to
control Youth A’s legs. Therapist 1 did not see any part of Staff 1
on the neck or upper body of Youth A. Therapist 1 described
Youth A as “inconsolable” at that point, yelling and spitting while
doing so. Therapist 1 recalled hearing Staff 1 state “Hey man, I
can’t let you go until you calm down.” Therapist 1 recalled seeing
Staff 2 grab a towel to place under Youth A’s head. Therapist 1
stepped out again to see if any other assistance could be had. As
3

she did she heard Youth A yell that Staff 1 was choking him and
that Staff 1 hit him. Therapist 1 did not see if this occurred or not.
Therapist 1 did not go back to the cottage and did not see how the
incident ended. She recalled speaking with Youth A after the fact
about the restraint. Youth A stated to her that he received
scratches and bruises from the incident, but then stated that they
likely came from a previous AWOL He did not attribute any
injuries specifically to Staff 1. She recalled talking about the
restraint with Youth A and Youth A did not state Staff 1 hit or
choked him when it occurred.
Staff 2 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 during an
announced, face-to-face visit to the facility on 05/13/2025. He
recalled being alone with Youth A in the cottage when the incident
began. Staff 2 could not recall why Youth A was upset. Youth A
first escalated physically by throwing trash cans around the
cottage inside. Staff 2 recalled parts of the trash cans breaking off
and hitting Staff 2. He called for assistance on the radio. Staff 1
quickly came inside. Youth A grabbed a milk crate and swung it at
Staff 1. Staff 1 was able to grab the milk crate away from Youth
A, but Youth A put his hands on Staff 1. Staff 2 recalled seeing
Staff 1 attempt to restrain Youth A by placing his hands up under
Youth A’s armpits while facing him standing up. Youth A was
struggling against this and yelling at Staff 1. Staff 2 did not
believe Staff 1 was saying anything at that point. Staff 2 recalled
seeing Youth A slip and fall to the ground at this point, and Staff 1
then fell with him. Staff 2 did not see Staff 1 fall on top of Youth A
or put any of his weight on Youth A. Staff 2 confirmed Youth A
had fallen on his back and stayed in that position for the rest of the
incident. As Staff 1 attempted to hold back Youth A’s arms from
striking Staff 1, Staff 2 recalled him requesting Staff 2 to get some
towels to place under Youth A’s head. Staff 2 was aware of
previous head injuries to Youth A and knew Youth A often
slammed his own head on the ground during escalated incidents.
Staff 2 recalled hearing Staff 1 state “Talk to me, talk to me” to
Youth A. Staff 2 saw Staff 3 come in and attempt to help restrain
Youth A’s kicking legs. Youth A slowly calmed down enough for
the restraint to be ended. Staff 2 denied ever seeing Staff 1 hit
Youth A or accidentally choke Youth A in any form.
Youth B and Youth C were interviewed with DHHS Worker 1
during an announced, face-to-face visit to the facility on
05/13/2025. They both confirmed they were outside during the
incident and did not see what occurred.
4

Supervisor 1 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 over the
phone on 05/23/2025. She confirmed she came into the cottage
as the situation ended. She witnessed Youth A getting up off the
ground and moving around. Supervisor 1 stated Youth A did not
make any comments that Staff 1 had choked or harmed him in
anyway during the restraint.
Attempts were made to interview Staff 3 after his employment
with the facility ended on 05/23/2025 and 05/28/2025 with no
return contact made.
Video reviewed:
• Security camera footage dated 04/30/2025 of the incident
was provided and reviewed. The footage showed the
initiation of the restraint. Youth A could be seen attempting
to hit Staff 1 with a black object and as he did he fell
backwards to the ground. Staff 1 came down to the floor
with him and appeared to be straddling Youth A. Youth A
and Staff 1 were positioned around a corner and could not
be fully seen. The video footage ended with Youth A still
on the ground and the other staff involved standing near
him. There was nothing in the video footage that indicated
Staff 1 choking or placing any weight on Youth A’s neck.
Documentation reviewed:
• Facility policy titled “Crisis Prevention Institution -
Nonviolent Crisis Intervention” last revised 09/01/2024 was
reviewed. This policy instructed staff to use the trained
restraint model as an intervention for specific reasons
including “physical aggression toward another person.”
• Facility policy titled “Physical Intervention” last revised
09/01/2024 was reviewed. This policy and procedure
provided staff with requirements to be followed during a
restraint, including never hitting or kicking a youth.
• Incident report documentation describing the 04/30/2025
restraint was provided and reviewed. This documentation
described a two person restraint of Youth A occurring
because of his physically aggressive behavior.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per interviews with youth
and staff and documentation reviewed there was no evidence
found that during the 04/30/2025 incident Staff 1 choked or put
any of his weight on Youth A’s neck to restrict his breathing.
CONSULTATION:
Consultation was provided to the facility regarding staff being
coached on how to communicate well with each other as a youth
5

escalates in order to coordinate how they can respond together.
In addition, consultation was provided for the facility to ensure that
camera angles inside of the cottages cover as much living space
as possible and reduce blind spots.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction, prevention;
Title prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159
Section (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
Description manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the
severity of the youth’s behavior, chronological and
developmental age, size, gender, physical condition, medical
condition, psychiatric condition, and personal history, including
any history of trauma, and must be done in a manner
consistent with the youth’s treatment plan.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation The restraint performed on Youth A did not follow facility policy &
procedure.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1 on
05/02/2025. As he was described the restraint incident Youth A
recalled it started with Staff 1 attempting to take him to the ground
alone. Youth A thought that someone else may have come in
later to try to stop him from kicking, but he was not sure.
Staff 1 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 during an
announced, face-to-face visit to the facility on 05/13/2025. Staff 1
stated during his interview he initiated the restraint alone. He also
noted staff are not trained to attempt to restrain youth while on
their backs on the ground, but he felt the need to attempt this
because Youth A was still attempting to hit Staff 1.
Staff 2 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 during an
announced, face-to-face visit to the facility on 05/13/2025. Staff 2
was not sure how much of Staff 1’s weight was on top of Youth A
during points of the restraint. He believed once or twice Staff 2
leaned on Youth A’s midsection as Staff 1 was adjusting his
position. Staff 2 also recalled Staff 3 sitting on Youth A’s legs as
he attempted to gain control of them.
Youth B and Youth C were interviewed with DHHS Worker 1
during an announced, face-to-face visit to the facility on
6

05/13/2025. They both confirmed they were outside during the
incident and did not see what occurred.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 over the
phone on 05/23/2025. She confirmed she came into the cottage
as the situation ended. She witnessed Youth A getting up off the
ground and moving around.
Attempts were made to interview Staff 3 after his employment
with the facility ended on 05/23/2025 and 05/28/2025 with no
return contact made.
Video reviewed:
• Security camera footage dated 04/30/2025 of the incident
was provided and reviewed. Three views were available.
The first showed Youth A and Staff 1 physically engaged.
Youth A then swung a black object at Staff 1’s head and in
doing so he fell to the ground and landed on his back.
Youth A had contact with Staff 1 as this occurred and Staff
1 fell with him. Staff 1 did not appear to fall directly on top
of Youth A. Staff 1 was then seen straddling Youth A and
attempting to grab Youth A’s arms. The second view
showed Youth A on the ground with Staff 1 on top of him. It
could not be determined what exact position Staff 1 was in.
Staff 3 and Therapist 1 were standing nearby. Therapist 1
knelt down and appeared to attempt to address Youth A.
Staff 3 was later seen attempting to restrain Youth A’s legs.
Staff 1, Staff 2 and Staff 3 could be later seen standing
near Youth A while he was still laying on the ground, after
the restraint had ended.
Documentation reviewed:
• Facility policy titled “Physical Intervention” last revised
09/01/2024 was reviewed. This policy and procedure
provided staff with requirements to be followed during a
restraint, including never placing weight on a youth’s chest
or back. It later stated “Two or more staff members should
be involved in all physical interventions to help ensure
safety and accountability.” The sanctioned restraint holds
listed were Team Control and Child Control.
• Facility policy titled “Crisis Prevention Institution -
Nonviolent Crisis Intervention” last revised 09/01/2024 was
reviewed. This policy stated that “when single staffed, the
youth specialist cannot physically restrain a resident.” It
later stated, “Two or more staff members should be
7

involved in all physical interventions to help ensure safety
and accountability.”
• Personnel documentation was provided for the staff
involved in the incident:
o Staff 1 had no instances of discipline in his file and
was up to date on his restraint model training at the
time of the incident.
o Therapist 1 had no instances of discipline in her
file. She was not certified in the facility restraint
model.
o Staff 2 had no instances of discipline in his file and
was up to date on his restraint model training at the
time of the incident.
o Staff 3 had no instances of discipline in his file and
was up to date on his restraint model training at the
time of the incident.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as per interviews with
youth and staff and documentation reviewed Staff 1 attempted to
restrain Youth A alone against facility policy, and in doing so
positioned himself outside of the trained holds in the approved
restraint model.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR # 2025SIC0000304 dated 5/6/2025, CAP approved 5/30/2025
SIR # 2024SIC0001698 dated 2/8/2025, CAP approved 3/14/2025
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
